page.title: 04Catholic School Life
page.content: At{St. John Fisher School}we do much the same as in an ordinary school. The difference is that every day there is some religious activity. Sometimes a hymn or a prayer is said at the beginning of the day or there is an assembly in which there are prayers. There is grace before meals and we end the day with prayers. In R.E. (Religious Education) children get to know more about Jesus and about all the parables he told. Sometimes on special occassions the whole school has a Mass. Either we walk to the nearest church or a priest comes to the school and says Mass there. We are taught to model ourselves on the life of Jesus. Because we are a Catholic school not all the children are local but many come on coaches from places like Epping, Ongar and Waltham Abbey.
